column3: Description
The birth of the patient.
Determine from statistics on life expectancy if the patient will die in the next year.
The current age of the patient.
The gender of the patient.
Whether the patient will die within the next year.
The death of the patient.
The patient starts school on the 1st of September after their  5th birthday.
The patient ends their education after 10 years and 10 months in education.
Calcuation of whether the patient becomes asthmatic in childhood.
Predisposition of a child for developing asthma.
Predisposition of an asthmatic child for having each severity of asthma.
The number of childhood asthmatics who have each severity of asthma.
Whether the patient has asthma, diagnosed or not.
The time until the child develops asthma and will start experiencing symptoms.
The severity of the patients asthma.
The start of the patient having asthma and therefore having a chance of getting symptoms and being diagnosed from then on.
An event in which the patients asthma triggers occurs and may causes symptoms.
Determine if existing symptoms will continue.
The risk of the current symptoms continuing.
The patient recovering from a symptoms event.
Determine if the patient will die from the current symptoms.
The patient's predisposition to death from severe asthma symptoms.
The death of the patient from asthma.
Whether the patient has current adult supervision to help manage asthma symptoms.
Deciding what to do about the current symptoms the patient is experiencing.
A score indicating how serious the symptoms appear to be based on severity, length of time experiencing symptoms.
The action to be taken in response to surrent symptoms
The patient seeks and adult to  help.
Nothing is done to alleviate symptoms
The patient takes medication as prescribed to them for exacerbations of asthma (eg. Taking emergency inhaler).
The patient visits to the emergency room to recover.
Deciding whether to go the GP following symptoms.
Whether the patient will see the GP to follow up on symptoms or not.

column1: Decide to Edit Asthma Action Plan
column3: Decision as to whether to update or create an asthma action plan for the patient.
Editing or creating an asthma action plan for the patient.
The patient visits the GP.
The GP Decide whether to diagnose the patient as an asthmatic.
The GP diagnoses the patient as asthmatic (creates record, prescribes medication etc.)
Whether the patient has a diagnosis of asthma.
Determine how well the patient will follow the advice given by their GP and take medication as directed.
How compliant the patient is in taking their medication and reacting to asthma symptoms appropriately.
The patients' first given name
The patients' surname
The name of the patients inhaler to be used to maintain their asthma
The colour of the patients inhaler to be used to maintain their asthma
The number of puffs of the patients preventative inhaler to be taken in the morning
The number of puffs of the patients preventative inhaler to be taken at night
A list of any other medicines to be taken every day and their details
The name of the patients inhaler to be used to relieve asthma symptoms
The colour of the patients inhaler to be used to relieve asthma symptoms
The number of puffs of the patients reliever inhaler to be taken when experiencing asthma symptoms
The highest peak flow the patient has recorded
Does the patient experience symptoms due to exercising
How many puffs of the patients reliever inhaler should be taken before sport if the patient experiences symptoms due to exercise
The peak flow value at which if below this value the patient is experiencing worsened asthma
The number of puffs of the patients reliever inhaler to be taken when experiencing worsened asthma
The peak flow value at which if below this value the patient is experiencing an asthma attack
The number of puffs of the patients reliever inhaler to be taken when experiencing an asthma attack
A list of trigger that cause asthma symptoms in the patient
The date the patient was given the asthma action plan
The date the patient should next have an asthma review
The contact details of the patients doctor or asthma nurse
